page.title: 05Monmouth-a Local History 1.
page.content: The 13th century{Monnow Bridge {Gateway}stands astride the River Monnow and is the only fortified bridge gate in the country. The{Nelson Museum,}houses a collection bequeathed by Lady Llangattock,the prize exhibit being Nelson's fighting sword.The local history centre also houses artifacts connected with Charles Rolls co-founder of{Rolls-Royce. The{Castle and Great Castle House birth place of{King Henry the {fifth,}played an important part in the Civil War.Now the head quarters of the {Royal Monmouthshire Engineers. {The Shire Hall}one of the fine Georgian buildings in the town.Assizes held here from 1792 to 1939{Chartists trial and deportation ordered here.
